casebody.data:
Helen B. Bates v. Detroit Mutual Benefit Association. Mutual benefit associations — Insurance.

[See ante, p. 426.]

Mandamus does not lie to compel a mutual benefit insurance company to levy an assessment to pay the amount falling due upon the death of a member; the proper course is to bring suit upon the undertaking; of the company.

Motion for order to show cause.

Submitted and denied October 18.

John Athmson for the motion.
